blog.title: Hello I am A Human Potato

summary:
Me: ** shows mom move mv*
Mom: Is this BTS?
Me: No this is Taemin. He's from SM.
Mom: Oh is he the gay kpop idol?
Me: No that's...
body:
Holland, Taemin, BTS?

Me: ** shows mom move mv*

Mom: Is this BTS?

Me: No this is Taemin. He’s from SM.

Mom: Oh is he the gay kpop idol?

Me: No that’s Holland.

Mom: Oh….

reblog.comment:

Me: ** shows mom move mv*

Mom: Is this BTS?

Me: No this is Taemin. He’s from SM.

Mom: Oh is he the gay kpop idol?

Me: No that’s Holland.

Mom: Oh….

trail.content_raw:

Mom: Is this BTS?

Me: No this is Taemin. He’s from SM.

Mom: Oh is he the gay kpop idol?

Me: No that’s Holland.

Mom: Oh….
trail.content:
Holland, Taemin, BTS?

Me: ** shows mom move mv*

Mom: Is this BTS?

Me: No this is Taemin. He’s from SM.

Mom: Oh is he the gay kpop idol?

Me: No that’s Holland.

Mom: Oh….

summary: Hey can i get a description ship with got7, straykids and bts? I have long brown hair with bangs. I’m thai/norwegian and 5'1. I...
body:
Hey can i get a description ship with got7, straykids and bts? I have long brown hair with bangs. I’m thai/norwegian and 5'1. I love going out, but i often need alone days. I’m a party girl but I enjoy hanging out with my own small group of people. People tell me i’m either a cute baby, a mom or wild af hahaha no in between. I love music and I used to play in a band. Everything that can be called art is really intriguing to me. I also love books and my cat hahahh.

Thank you so much in advantage if you decide to do it 💕

Thank you so much for requesting! Again sorry for just being able to do BTS but please feel free to request again once the written ships are open for stray kids and got7 again~

In BTS I ship you with…
…Yoongi!

I think that out of all of them that Yoongi would understand your need for alone days. I even think that he needs some space from time to time as well, especially when he is working one something. This will then instead of being a problem between you two something that you could provide for each other. He likes especially your mom personality because it allows you to be able to take care of him well, which when he gets caught up in something he’ll need.

I also think that it’s good that you enjoy going out, but do stay with smaller groups because this way you might get him to loosen up a little without pulling him totally out of his comfort zone. Your cute and wild sides are also a big help in this! 

Lastly I do feel like he loves that music is such a big factor in your live. Music is so big in his live that he needs to be able to share this with his significant other. He needs to be able to talk about songs and what is so intriguing about him and I think the same goes for you. You playing in a band might even make you capable to advise him! He can definitely advice you though if you’ll ever need it :3

Sorry we just had to use this picture it’s to priceless

Hopefully you’ve enjoyed your request and have a nice day~

~Admin Chan

summary: These past few nights I've been dreaming with a different bts guy every night. Last night was hobi, two nights ago was kookie,...
body: These past few nights I’ve been dreaming with a different bts guy every night. Last night was hobi, two nights ago was kookie, three nights ago was jin, four nights ago it was yoongi… Everytime i wake up i feel like ive been attacked with feelings towards each one of them and i love it but I’m so tired.

Last night was hobi, two nights ago was kookie, three nights ago was jin, four nights ago it was yoongi… Everytime i wake up i feel like ive been attacked with feelings towards each one of them and i love it but I’m so tired.

masterlist

summary: Skinny Love Pairing: Jungkook x Reader Words: 1k8 Genre: Fluff Description: oh skinny love, will you tell me you love me first?...
body:
Skinny Love

Pairing: Jungkook x Reader

Words: 1k8

Genre: Fluff

Description: oh skinny love, will you tell me you love me first?

“Here,” you said as you threw the chill can of soda onto his lap and plopped down into the sofa right next to him.

Today was one of the off days the boys had from their busy schedules. Jungkook had spent over an our whining to you over the phone, insisting that you come over to watch the basketball match and you went anyway, despite the fact that you didn’t know much about basketball and the volume of coursework pilling up.

“Thanks,” he whispered in your ear once you were close enough. The way his breath fanned your face tickled your ear causing you to emit a length of giggles.

“What are you giggling about?” Taehyung asked curiously across the room as he eyed the both of you. Knowing him, he wanted in on the fun the both of you were having.

“Nothing.” Jungkook replied defensively with a smirk on his face, unwilling to spill. Taehyung’s gaze travelled from his younger member to you, expecting an answer but was met with disappointment as Jungkook’s hand covered your mouth.

“Ew, take it off or I’ll lick it,” you threatened but you were only met with a firm no from the boy, his eyes gleaming with mischief. Knowing exactly where to target, your hands reached over to poke his sides making him swallow his laughter and squirm in his seat.

“Get a room.” It usually had to be a special occasion when Yoongi’s voice would make an appearance as he was always drowned out by the louder members but at times like these he always threw the snarkiest comments. 

“Or just get together already,” Namjoon threw into the wind causing the both of you to stop in your tracks immediately. Like two well punished kindergarten kids, the both of you remained unbelievably quiet the rest of the game. Despite the small pokes you would get from Jungkook time to time, you remained focus on the game and ignored him completely.

You had met the boy a year ago at a friend’s house warming party. It was a small occasion with a few old and new friends. Jungkook was introduced to you there as Bangtan Sonyeondan’s golden maknae. To you, BTS wasn’t exactly unheard of. His name had always came up in passing between the giggles of schoolgirls and even subway advertisements. You weren’t exactly their biggest fan nor did you hate their music which made you quite neutral to the idea of meeting him. Your image of a stuck up arrogant boy, as you imagined most celebrities would be, was immediately shot down when you first met him and the both of you hit it off right from the start. Maybe it was because of the small age difference but it seemed that the both of you spoke in this weird wavelength that no one else could comprehend and you enjoyed it. You liked how you finally found someone who seemed to understand you.

In that one year, you grew closer to him. In between movie nights and take away Fridays, you met the rest of the boys during one of their dance practice and they seemed to liked you, constantly asking you when you’d come over. In that one year, you witnessed Jungkook’s passion for music grow as you watched him perform on the stage. He didn’t even had to get you tickets, you had bought them yourself to surprise him, along with a banner that said you were his number one fan. 

And in that one year, you also started to slowly fall for him. To you it didn’t make sense. You couldn’t comprehend how one day he was just your friend and then the next you suddenly found it hard to breathe when he would come a little closer than he usually would.

And you knew he liked you too. The signs were obvious, from the way he would text you to ask you if you got home safely to the way he easily gets flustered when the other members tease him about you. You adored the way he would stumble across his words when his cheeks flushed with colour. But the both of you weren’t exactly dating. 

Skinny love, the other boys always remind you.

It was around three months ago when you were alone in the dorm’s kitchen with Seokjin and you confided in him. Jungkook was out of sight, taking a shower after a long day of practice. 

“It’s not that you don’t know whether he likes you, it’s so obvious, so why aren’t the both of you together?” He asked.

“I don’t know,” you reasoned, “he should be the one asking me to be his girlfriend, not the other way around.”

“How about you confess instead?” His question left you dumbfounded at the idea and as appealing as it sounded, your numerous attempts were met with great failure.

You had once wrote your confession in black ink on a full Coca-Cola bottle. With jittery nerves and shaky hands, you gave it to Jungkook asking him to drink it hoping he would see it when he finishes. However before he did, a thirsty Jimin snatched it away and threw it in the bin after he was done. 

Another time, you had wrote him a letter of confession for him to bring on tour only to find the day after he left that you gave him the wrong piece of paper, one with your history notes instead. 

You also had tried the subtle signs, like leaving your hand on the armrest in a movie theatre or giving him a peck on his cheek before he left for tour but he always took it as a friendly signs instead of something more. And suddenly cheeks kisses and hand holding were a norm in your friendship which flustered you greatly all the time.

You had tried the more obvious ways too, like asking him to go on a pizza date once but Taehyung’s voice was too loud in the background that he had missed the word ‘date’ and you were too embarrassed to repeat yourself.

So you had given up, you had decided to just wait for him to confess instead. 

“What’s wrong? Are you mad at me?” Jungkook whispered in your ear just as the game was about to end. You weren’t exactly mad, you were just kinda annoyed at the fact that the boys had so obviously put it out there but Jungkook being Jungkook still didn’t get the hint. It wasn’t the first time and it surely wouldn’t be the last either.

“No.” You replied quite loudly catching the attention of the other boys in the room but Jungkook didn’t buy it. He knew you well enough to tell that your body expression said otherwise. In normal circumstances, if he ever poked you, you would have poked him right back causing a huge ‘fight’ but this time you just weren’t quite in the mood.

“Just go talk it out in the room,” Seokjin pleaded. As he was the one you usually confided in, he understood how you felt, “and don’t come out until you’re done.” 

However, he was met with resistance and stubbornness from the both of you but he didn’t give up. He ended up dragging you into Jungkook’s room as Jungkook followed closely behind like a lost puppy.

“Just tell him,” he told you as he closed the door shut and walked back to the living room to watch the game.

The atmosphere in the room was tense and awkward, more than it has ever been with Jungkook. With him, it was always banter and laughter, joy and happiness. This was something new and the tension made your legs weak. You sat down at the edge of his bed and attempted to steady your mind.

“What? What does hyung know that I don’t?” Jungkook asked as he walked over to you and stared down into your eyes. His eyes held a certain type of softness and it made you weak for him, just like the first day you met him. 

You looked back at him, uncertain of how to answer, unsure of how to react without actually confessing. 

“Tell me.” He whined with a pout on his lips.Usually his aegyo didn’t work on you but it did this time and you blamed his pout for what happened next.

If it wasn’t for his pout, you wouldn’t have looked at his lips. If you didn’t look at his lips, you wouldn’t have wondered what it feels like to kiss him and if you didn’t wonder, you wouldn’t have said what you were going to say next.

“That I’m going to do something stupid.” You said as you stood up, your eyes merely reaching the tips of his lips. Before he could even respond, you closed your eyes, stood on your tiptoes and touched your lips against his, softly and hesitantly, before pulling away. His lips tasted sugary, like the soda you gave him earlier and it was addictive. Your insides were shaking with fear. You had expected him to push you away. Your hands were trembling with nerves. What had you just done? But the thought that haunted you the most was that you wanted to pull him back in for another. 

When you opened your eyes, you were met with a blank look on Jungkook’s face. The only indication that he understood what happened was the colour of his cheeks flushing red. It took a moment for him to process what had just happened before a smile crept onto his lips.

“Do that again.” He whispered in a hoarse voice.

He took one step closer towards you and you took a step back, making you fall onto the bed. His arms wrapped around you as you fell, attempting to soften the blow but he ended up crushing you instead.

“Ow.” You said in between laughter as you rubbed the part of your rib his arm jabbed into. Everything felt clumsy and you liked it because it made everything else feel so insanely real. You liked how the first kiss wasn’t perfect.

“Sorry.” 

He crashed his soft lips onto yours again and you wondered if you would ever forget how they taste like. You hoped that you never do. His hands were tangled in your hair in an attempt you pull you closer as yours roamed his chiseled back. 

This was finally it. You were kissing him. The months of waiting and wondering showed in the way he touched you. Everything felt more urgent from the pressure on your lips to the way his hands moved but there was still gentleness. With Jungkook, there was always gentleness in the way he moved his lips and caressed your cheek. 

You kissed him. Again and again and again, willing to memorise the way he kissed, the way he smells, the way his lips feel. You want to remember it all now but you know you have a lifetime to and nothing beats that feeling. Suddenly, all the urgency is gone and you find yourself melting into his lips, enjoying every touch, every tingle, every spark going off in your heart.

“Be safe kids!” You heard Hoseok yell from the living room. Jungkook smiled into the kiss and you found yourself doing the same.

“What took you so long?” You asked when the both of you pulled away for breath.

“I just wanted to make sure you wanted it as much as I did.”

“Do that again.” He whispered in a hoarse voice.

“Do that again.” He whispered in a hoarse voice.

He took one step closer towards you and you took a step back, making you fall onto the bed. His arms wrapped around you as you fell, attempting to soften the blow but he ended up crushing you instead.

“Ow.” You said in between laughter as you rubbed the part of your rib his arm jabbed into. Everything felt clumsy and you liked it because it made everything else feel so insanely real. You liked how the first kiss wasn’t perfect.

“Sorry.” 

He crashed his soft lips onto yours again and you wondered if you would ever forget how they taste like. You hoped that you never do. His hands were tangled in your hair in an attempt you pull you closer as yours roamed his chiseled back. 

This was finally it. You were kissing him. The months of waiting and wondering showed in the way he touched you. Everything felt more urgent from the pressure on your lips to the way his hands moved but there was still gentleness. With Jungkook, there was always gentleness in the way he moved his lips and caressed your cheek. 

You kissed him. Again and again and again, willing to memorise the way he kissed, the way he smells, the way his lips feel. You want to remember it all now but you know you have a lifetime to and nothing beats that feeling. Suddenly, all the urgency is gone and you find yourself melting into his lips, enjoying every touch, every tingle, every spark going off in your heart.

“Be safe kids!” You heard Hoseok yell from the living room. Jungkook smiled into the kiss and you found yourself doing the same.

“What took you so long?” You asked when the both of you pulled away for breath.

“I just wanted to make sure you wanted it as much as I did.”
trail.content:
Skinny Love

Pairing: Jungkook x Reader

Words: 1k8

Genre: Fluff

Description: oh skinny love, will you tell me you love me first?

“Here,” you said as you threw the chill can of soda onto his lap and plopped down into the sofa right next to him.

Today was one of the off days the boys had from their busy schedules. Jungkook had spent over an our whining to you over the phone, insisting that you come over to watch the basketball match and you went anyway, despite the fact that you didn’t know much about basketball and the volume of coursework pilling up.

“Thanks,” he whispered in your ear once you were close enough. The way his breath fanned your face tickled your ear causing you to emit a length of giggles.

“What are you giggling about?” Taehyung asked curiously across the room as he eyed the both of you. Knowing him, he wanted in on the fun the both of you were having.

“Nothing.” Jungkook replied defensively with a smirk on his face, unwilling to spill. Taehyung’s gaze travelled from his younger member to you, expecting an answer but was met with disappointment as Jungkook’s hand covered your mouth.

“Ew, take it off or I’ll lick it,” you threatened but you were only met with a firm no from the boy, his eyes gleaming with mischief. Knowing exactly where to target, your hands reached over to poke his sides making him swallow his laughter and squirm in his seat.

“Get a room.” It usually had to be a special occasion when Yoongi’s voice would make an appearance as he was always drowned out by the louder members but at times like these he always threw the snarkiest comments. 

“Or just get together already,” Namjoon threw into the wind causing the both of you to stop in your tracks immediately. Like two well punished kindergarten kids, the both of you remained unbelievably quiet the rest of the game. Despite the small pokes you would get from Jungkook time to time, you remained focus on the game and ignored him completely.

You had met the boy a year ago at a friend’s house warming party. It was a small occasion with a few old and new friends. Jungkook was introduced to you there as Bangtan Sonyeondan’s golden maknae. To you, BTS wasn’t exactly unheard of. His name had always came up in passing between the giggles of schoolgirls and even subway advertisements. You weren’t exactly their biggest fan nor did you hate their music which made you quite neutral to the idea of meeting him. Your image of a stuck up arrogant boy, as you imagined most celebrities would be, was immediately shot down when you first met him and the both of you hit it off right from the start. Maybe it was because of the small age difference but it seemed that the both of you spoke in this weird wavelength that no one else could comprehend and you enjoyed it. You liked how you finally found someone who seemed to understand you.

In that one year, you grew closer to him. In between movie nights and take away Fridays, you met the rest of the boys during one of their dance practice and they seemed to liked you, constantly asking you when you’d come over. In that one year, you witnessed Jungkook’s passion for music grow as you watched him perform on the stage. He didn’t even had to get you tickets, you had bought them yourself to surprise him, along with a banner that said you were his number one fan. 

And in that one year, you also started to slowly fall for him. To you it didn’t make sense. You couldn’t comprehend how one day he was just your friend and then the next you suddenly found it hard to breathe when he would come a little closer than he usually would.

And you knew he liked you too. The signs were obvious, from the way he would text you to ask you if you got home safely to the way he easily gets flustered when the other members tease him about you. You adored the way he would stumble across his words when his cheeks flushed with colour. But the both of you weren’t exactly dating. 

Skinny love, the other boys always remind you.

It was around three months ago when you were alone in the dorm’s kitchen with Seokjin and you confided in him. Jungkook was out of sight, taking a shower after a long day of practice. 

“It’s not that you don’t know whether he likes you, it’s so obvious, so why aren’t the both of you together?” He asked.

“I don’t know,” you reasoned, “he should be the one asking me to be his girlfriend, not the other way around.”

“How about you confess instead?” His question left you dumbfounded at the idea and as appealing as it sounded, your numerous attempts were met with great failure.

You had once wrote your confession in black ink on a full Coca-Cola bottle. With jittery nerves and shaky hands, you gave it to Jungkook asking him to drink it hoping he would see it when he finishes. However before he did, a thirsty Jimin snatched it away and threw it in the bin after he was done. 

Another time, you had wrote him a letter of confession for him to bring on tour only to find the day after he left that you gave him the wrong piece of paper, one with your history notes instead. 

You also had tried the subtle signs, like leaving your hand on the armrest in a movie theatre or giving him a peck on his cheek before he left for tour but he always took it as a friendly signs instead of something more. And suddenly cheeks kisses and hand holding were a norm in your friendship which flustered you greatly all the time.

You had tried the more obvious ways too, like asking him to go on a pizza date once but Taehyung’s voice was too loud in the background that he had missed the word ‘date’ and you were too embarrassed to repeat yourself.

So you had given up, you had decided to just wait for him to confess instead. 

“What’s wrong? Are you mad at me?” Jungkook whispered in your ear just as the game was about to end. You weren’t exactly mad, you were just kinda annoyed at the fact that the boys had so obviously put it out there but Jungkook being Jungkook still didn’t get the hint. It wasn’t the first time and it surely wouldn’t be the last either.

“No.” You replied quite loudly catching the attention of the other boys in the room but Jungkook didn’t buy it. He knew you well enough to tell that your body expression said otherwise. In normal circumstances, if he ever poked you, you would have poked him right back causing a huge ‘fight’ but this time you just weren’t quite in the mood.

“Just go talk it out in the room,” Seokjin pleaded. As he was the one you usually confided in, he understood how you felt, “and don’t come out until you’re done.” 

However, he was met with resistance and stubbornness from the both of you but he didn’t give up. He ended up dragging you into Jungkook’s room as Jungkook followed closely behind like a lost puppy.

“Just tell him,” he told you as he closed the door shut and walked back to the living room to watch the game.

The atmosphere in the room was tense and awkward, more than it has ever been with Jungkook. With him, it was always banter and laughter, joy and happiness. This was something new and the tension made your legs weak. You sat down at the edge of his bed and attempted to steady your mind.

“What? What does hyung know that I don’t?” Jungkook asked as he walked over to you and stared down into your eyes. His eyes held a certain type of softness and it made you weak for him, just like the first day you met him. 

You looked back at him, uncertain of how to answer, unsure of how to react without actually confessing. 

“Tell me.” He whined with a pout on his lips.Usually his aegyo didn’t work on you but it did this time and you blamed his pout for what happened next.

If it wasn’t for his pout, you wouldn’t have looked at his lips. If you didn’t look at his lips, you wouldn’t have wondered what it feels like to kiss him and if you didn’t wonder, you wouldn’t have said what you were going to say next.

“That I’m going to do something stupid.” You said as you stood up, your eyes merely reaching the tips of his lips. Before he could even respond, you closed your eyes, stood on your tiptoes and touched your lips against his, softly and hesitantly, before pulling away. His lips tasted sugary, like the soda you gave him earlier and it was addictive. Your insides were shaking with fear. You had expected him to push you away. Your hands were trembling with nerves. What had you just done? But the thought that haunted you the most was that you wanted to pull him back in for another. 

When you opened your eyes, you were met with a blank look on Jungkook’s face. The only indication that he understood what happened was the colour of his cheeks flushing red. It took a moment for him to process what had just happened before a smile crept onto his lips.

“Do that again.” He whispered in a hoarse voice.

He took one step closer towards you and you took a step back, making you fall onto the bed. His arms wrapped around you as you fell, attempting to soften the blow but he ended up crushing you instead.

“Ow.” You said in between laughter as you rubbed the part of your rib his arm jabbed into. Everything felt clumsy and you liked it because it made everything else feel so insanely real. You liked how the first kiss wasn’t perfect.

“Sorry.” 

He crashed his soft lips onto yours again and you wondered if you would ever forget how they taste like. You hoped that you never do. His hands were tangled in your hair in an attempt you pull you closer as yours roamed his chiseled back. 

This was finally it. You were kissing him. The months of waiting and wondering showed in the way he touched you. Everything felt more urgent from the pressure on your lips to the way his hands moved but there was still gentleness. With Jungkook, there was always gentleness in the way he moved his lips and caressed your cheek. 

You kissed him. Again and again and again, willing to memorise the way he kissed, the way he smells, the way his lips feel. You want to remember it all now but you know you have a lifetime to and nothing beats that feeling. Suddenly, all the urgency is gone and you find yourself melting into his lips, enjoying every touch, every tingle, every spark going off in your heart.

“Be safe kids!” You heard Hoseok yell from the living room. Jungkook smiled into the kiss and you found yourself doing the same.

“What took you so long?” You asked when the both of you pulled away for breath.

“I just wanted to make sure you wanted it as much as I did.”
